sydney_scene1.name: Introduction to Destruction
sydney_scene1.dialog: The city is enveloped with chaos.
There are children screaming in the streets!
We've got to get out, and we've got to move now.
I told you it would come to this.
You wanted this anarchy and now you have it.
I've got an entire nation in lockdown.
How do you propose getting your sorry caboose out of here?
The power of the people has traditionally been stronger than the armed forced, once mobilized.
We've got to get out, and we've got to move now.

sydney_scene2.name: Strange Land, Strangers
sydney_scene2.dialog: So, what do you make of this place?
The people seem wary of us.
I was beginning to wonder if it was just me...
It's not just you, boss. There is a paranoia in the air.
I can't quite put my finger on it.
A minor complaint, but something to keep an eye on.

sydney_scene3.name: Eight Hour Climb
sydney_scene3.dialog: Have you even been in the city streets?
Have you talked to the people you represent?
You profit just as much as we do. You know that.
We're not hoarding the food supply to create a state of unrest.
All you do it add sugar to water. Any idiot could do that.
What we do is moral. The people want it.
They don't want to starve. To stink. To drink dirty water.
Then share some of your water with them.
You know, the water we provide safe passage for.

sydney_scene4.name: Elusive Brass Razoo
sydney_scene4.dialog: How are you coping with doing something you hate for money?
I never hated running the factory.
Building something I was proud of.
Now my back aches as I make someone else rich.
We've had everything taken from us. We can work our way back to the top.

sydney_scene5.name: The Opulance
sydney_scene5.dialog: You know the deal. The money stays the same.
You know this! I have already explained this to you.
Yes! I have already given it to you. Sign it and give it back to me.
Last time I saw you. For goodness sake, you weirdo blue collar slob.
You uncouth foul mouthed money hungry...

sydney_scene6.name: Incredible Machinations
sydney_scene6.dialog: For me the pistons are a heartbeat.
The gears grind out an imperial pulse.
Of course I do. What sort of a question is that?
The same question you asked me about my love.

sydney_scene7.name: Professional Crastination
sydney_scene7.dialog: You know exactly what, little boy.
You're a real class act, you know.
You're required to be part of this.
I will not be part of your wretched conspriracy.
It's already begun. You're in whether you like it or not.
Your free will is a fantastical notion.

sydney_scene8.name: Warning Siren
sydney_scene8.dialog: Warning sirens sound out across the city.
I wonder if I made the right decision.
Moving here, to Sydney, with my wife and kids.
On board the shipping vessels, life was different.
It may have clouded my judgement, but the harbour was so beautiful.
The buildings full of character and incredible workmanship.
It was a city I knew I belonged in.
At least I think I did.
Now I dont know what to think.

sydney_scene9.name: Winter Comes
sydney_scene9.dialog: I feel gawked at. I feel peoples eyes on me constantly.
Do they stare because I'm different?
What are they all looking at?
And why should I care anyway?

sydney_scene10.name: From The Basement
sydney_scene10.dialog: While you were the Father from the church came by.
He came across a couple who have just arrived here.
They don't speak much English, and he could really use our help.
Yes! They are staying in temporary residence.
Let's get down there and visit.

sydney_scene11.name: The Rowdy And The Wicked
sydney_scene11.dialog: While you were the Father from the church came by.
He came across a couple who have just arrived here.
They don't speak much English, and he could really use our help.
Yes! They are staying in temporary residence.
Let's get down there and visit.

sydney_scene12.name: On The Outside
sydney_scene12.dialog: Temporary residence? No! That is not residential anything.
It was a room with a small sink at the side of a bar.
Drunks roam past and in and out of the laundry room.
They can have the spare room.
I will not sleep knowing they are living like that.

sydney_scene13.name: The End
sydney_scene13.dialog: What luck! Our buddy having an apartment for rent.
We helped our new friends find a place to stay.
I'm sure they could have done it on their own.
It just would have been so much harder.
I think the biggest way you helped was by explaining some of local jargon.
They were quite confused when asked to "bring a plate".

newyork_scene1.name: Breaking Baddies
newyork_scene1.dialog: There's not much we can do.
As much as it pains me to say it, we need to run.
This isn't about doing what's best or what is right.
This isn't about doing what we have to do.

newyork_scene2.name: The 212
newyork_scene2.dialog: Literally halfway around the world, and I find you again.
Squeezing every last dollar from every business.
I daresay you're out of your depth, little man.
From the first time I met you, I knew it would be no good.
The involvement, the quotas, the supposed tax breaks.
That was all small time amateur hour on your end.
Those same tricks won't fly here.
I'll make whatever I want fly. You'll see.

newyork_scene3.name: Crooklyn
newyork_scene3.dialog: This is one hell of a town.
This town will bow before once I'm done.
I'm going to be checking out the culinary delights.

newyork_scene4.name: Manhattan, West Bound
newyork_scene4.dialog: The public transport here is a sight to behold.
The investment to infrastructure is amazing.
The sheer amount of work was done by many but very few profited.
I'd say the community profits with access to such wonderfully designed transportation.
The community can benefit but it's the powerful few who profit.

newyork_scene5.name: Our Lady Peace
newyork_scene5.dialog: The Statue of Liberty stands so tall.
You never really know until you stand beneath her.
The feeling of being so small.
Being part of something bigger than yourself.
Being part of the human civilisation.
We could all be better people after staring into her eyes.
We could all hold a torch.

newyork_scene6.name: Hot Dog Stand
newyork_scene6.dialog: I had a hot dog from a street vendor.
It was everything I wanted and more.
I think this could really take off back home.

newyork_scene7.name: To The East
newyork_scene7.dialog: You're preparing the machinary to specification?
There machines arrived in good shape.
So you'll be done by Monday?
Depends if those Lemonade jerks interupt us.
I'll make sure they stay away.

newyork_scene8.name: Grid Lock
newyork_scene8.dialog: As I walk through to dark alleys of New York City.
I'm often reminded of something my dad said to me.
He said Son, you're still young,
and you always jump the gun.
And I no longer wanted to be the guy who jumped the gun.

newyork_scene9.name: Beneath City Hall
newyork_scene9.dialog: Take the well light streets home.
You really needn't worry about me.
Streets, well lit or not, are no more dangerous here than back home.
There's just more cars on the road.
The cars are not the problems, the shifty cretins might enjoy your diamond wedding ring.
Maybe you should teach me some judo moves if I'm so helpless.

newyork_scene10.name: Bodega
newyork_scene10.dialog: I made a desert called a Cronut.
A mix between a croisant and a donut.
The French called me a sellout.
And the food critics declared me dead on arrival.

newyork_scene11.name: Alright Already
newyork_scene11.dialog: I keep chasing that elusive brass razoo.

newyork_scene13.name: End Sequence For NY
newyork_scene13.dialog: The jukebox at the soda shop plays all my favorite songs.
And all I can think of is the business we left behind.
The soda bottles clink and I am reminded of home.
I can't even buy a durian in this city.
Let alone a dragonfruit or a good plate of gado gado.
The things I would do for a fresh durian.

military_scene1.name: No Innocent Victim
military_scene1.dialog: Behind enemy lines is often the safest place to be.
From base to base, every one feels the same.
To get through here we'll need you two to keep your eyes open...

military_scene3.name: Big Money
military_scene3.dialog: With the military in charge of many local businesses,
Big money bonuses for destroying competitors.

military_scene4.name: Walled City
military_scene4.dialog: The entire city will be walled and we will be the owners.

military_scene5.name: Broken Nose
military_scene5.dialog: The last business to fall was the national airline business.

military_scene6.name: Dirty Silence
military_scene6.dialog: I'm in the business of making money first and foremost.
Pain is the second business I'm in.
Aren't all businesses in the business of making money?

military_scene7.name: Butter Bing
military_scene7.dialog: Fresh butter, how sweet do you smell.

military_scene8.name: Air Raid Siren
military_scene8.dialog: We've got business to take care of.

military_scene9.name: Ten Of The Best
military_scene9.dialog: Our airforce has the toughest squadron on the planet.

military_scene10.name: Their Finest Hour
military_scene10.dialog: Their finest hour was also their last.

warehouse_scene13.name: Warehouse End Cut Scene
warehouse_scene13.dialog: Nothing has changed here since I was a kid.
You know what Thomas Wolfe said about going home?
He had valid points but I'm not George Webber...
...and I'm not interested in re-living my youth.

factory_scene13.name: Factory End Cut Scene
factory_scene13.dialog: Fresh ingredients in, refreshing drinks out.
Yuck, I am drenched in sweat. It's disgusting in here.
Let's get out of here, it's time to go home.

management_scene13.name: Warehouse End Cut Scene
management_scene13.dialog: Owning this factory will be a honor and a challenge.
I think we'll do a great job.
We signed on to supply the military with soft drinks for their rations.
I quite liked the new durian flavor we are now producing.
We won't be adopting our handyman's anarchist ideals.
We've managed to avoid the food inspector's wrath this time.
And us? We're still wildly in love.
